info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 1:56PM CDT until July 05 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL MCDONOUGH COUNTY... At 156 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over McDonough County 4-H Grounds, or over Macomb, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Macomb, Colchester, Good Hope, Bardolph, Tennessee, Sciota, Western Illinois University, Adair, Fandon, Colmar, Plymouth, Pennington Point, Macomb Municipal Airport, Spring Lake, McDonough County 4-H Grounds and Argyle Lake State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
